file_content.text: Our intelligence reports should be watertight again. All goes toward helping the war effort.
A lot of destroyed droids, a blocked comm signal and some very angry Imperial Intelligence agents. Good news travels fast.
Thank you. Please, take these.
I told you about the droid transponders and the communications dish, didn't I? I did.
Hmm. How do the best thieves work? Out in plain sight, where no one would ever suspect them.
Oh, sorry--I don't mean you, of course. I'm investigating several intelligence leaks; troop movements, secure transmissions and such.
The Empire's got a clever system to mask the leaked data transmissions. Actually had me stumped for a day or two. Hmm. I must be losing my touch.
Clever Imperials are trouble.
Oh, don't say that, not after I just made a breakthrough.
You learn more from the journey than the destination.
Take it as a lesson.
Journey, destination... hmm. I'll have to think on that. Later, though.
You can beat yourself up after these intelligence leaks are stopped.
Your regrets need to wait.
You make an excellent point. I'd just made a breakthrough, too.
No one can be talented, lucky and good-looking all the time. Or so I'm told.
Nobody's perfect.
Can you analyze transmission algorithms in your head, too? We'd make a marvelous team, once these leaks are addressed.
What's the Empire up to?
I'm really not interested.
You do realize those intelligence leaks probably contain data on you? The Empire hasn't forgotten about Corellia yet.
We detected a number of Imperial droid scouts, but they weren't a threat... until I worked out that's how the Empire's moving the data.
Bouncing the signal through those droids means we can't track it properly. Inspired. Almost a shame to undo the Imperials' hard work. Hmm. Like to help?
Sure.
Why aren't you doing it?
My specialty is strategic analysis; frankly, I'm a terrible shot. This needs to be done right the first time.
So... interrupting the signal. First, destroy those Imperial droids--they're armed, so mind yourself. Don't forget to take their transponders.
Then, jam the transmission signal. There's a communications dish not far from the droids; their transponder codes should give you access. Simple, really. Best of luck.
No. You're odd. [Refuse quest]
That's not an unreasonable position, I suppose. Take care.
The Empire's been cunning this time.
